title: italic with simple decorated capitals created in or before 1989
content:
Trying so hard to find this font, which was on my wedding invitation in 1989. Driving me nuts! Please help.

Font: 

 Abel Cursive (kursiv)

comments.content:
This style is usually called chancery. Might not be a digital version of this typeface. For substitutes available at Myfonts see [http://www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Achancery/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Achancery/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/tag%3Achancery/fonts/")  
Don

I cannot find that 'font', but it is a chancery style. Some similar styles without the ornaments on the initials would be Ophelia, Augusta Cancellaresca and Bradley Chancery (all at MyFonts).

- Mike Yanega

A few more Agedage Cancelleresca [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/agedage-cancelleresca/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/agedage-cancelleresca/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/agedage-cancelleresca/") Aphrodite [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-slim/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-slim/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-slim/") and [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesenses/aphrodite-pro/") Apple Chancery [popular for wedding invitations] and similar [http://www.identifont.com/similar?3IA](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/www.identifont.com/similar?3IA "http://www.identifont.com/similar?3IA") as well as the Cancellaresca rag at Myfonts [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Cancellaresca/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Cancellaresca/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Cancellaresca/fonts/")  
If you feel like browsing further just Google "fonts chancery" and scan through the images.  
All these fonts and no exact match.  
Don

I found this in a German book of Script types published in 1993. It is called Abel kursiv. If this is in digital form I have not found it by this name. The book lists Agfa as the source, but it's not in the 1999 Creative Alliance book.

- Mike Yanega

Luc Devrouye's [designer page](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/luc.devroye.org/longdesigners.html) lists the designer of "Abel Cursive" as Bernie Abel and says it was a Compugraphic font in 1974. I think that means it was a film type. Apparently, not digitized.

- Mike Yanega

Abel Cursive is shown on [this designer page](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-40567.html) on Luc's site. What a fantastic resource he is!

- Mike Yanega
I know that it was digitized as Abel Cursive Plain, Solid and Open Caps by Alan Prescott in 1996. Finding copies today? I had no luck.

Good find Mike Y! I wonder if this [http://prescottdesignshop.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/prescottdesignshop.com/ "http://prescottdesignshop.com/") and [http://prescottdesignshop.com/typography.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701094128/http:/prescottdesignshop.com/typography.html "http://prescottdesignshop.com/typography.html") is the same Alan Prescott and if he can tell us anything about availability of the font?  
Don
